title: Subtree of Another Tree
description: Given the roots of two binary trees root and subRoot, return true if there is a subtree of root with the same structure and node values of subRoot and false otherwise.
constraints: The number of nodes in the root tree is in the range [1, 2000].
The number of nodes in the subRoot tree is in the range [1, 1000].

brute-force.name: Recursive
brute-force.description: Check if subRoot matches at any node of root.

steps.instruction: Define the function is_subtree that takes root and subRoot.
Define helper same_tree to check equality.
steps.hint: Implement a helper to check if two trees are identical.

steps.instruction: If subRoot is None, it's a subtree.
steps.hint: An empty tree is a subtree of any tree.

steps.instruction: If root is None, it can't contain subRoot.
steps.hint: If root is empty but subRoot isn't, return False.

steps.instruction: Check if trees match or recurse.
steps.placeholderCode:
if same_tree(root, subRoot): return True
    return is_subtree(root.left, subRoot) or is_subtree(root.right, subRoot)
steps.hint:
Check if current trees match, or check left/right subtrees.

Example:
Root=3. SubRoot=4.
3 != 4. Check Left (4) vs SubRoot (4). Match found!
steps.solutionCode:
if same_tree(root, subRoot): return True
    return is_subtree(root.left, subRoot) or is_subtree(root.right, subRoot)

steps.instruction: Define the function is_subtree that takes root and subRoot.
